title: The Evolution of Aluminum Hydroxides During the AlN Powder Hydrolysis

author: Andraž Kocjan, Odsek za inženirsko keramiko, Institut "Jožef Stefan"

segmentation: Thank you for the introduction, Mr Chairman.
I'm PhD student from the Georgia Stephens.
International postgraduate school.
Aluminum nitrate powder is a ceramic material is commonly used as a substrate for power circuits.

Packaging material for integrated circuits due to its high thermal conductivity, high electrical resistivity, load electric constant and low thermal expansion coefficient, high strength and high temperature stability.
It is also used as a minor constituent in the formation of silence and is a sintering additive in Silicon carbide based ceramics.
Aluminum nitrate powder can be also used as a reactant in hydrolysis assisted solidification process, and as a precursor for nanostructured alumina coatings.
The reaction of aluminum nitrate powder with water has been known for a long time in the presence of water.
Aluminum nitric will decompose forming aluminum hydroxide an ammonia.
But in this opera application, this reaction is undesirable.

And that is why it is necessary to prevent the hydrolysis by using water resistant aluminum nitrate powder, or Alternatively, nonaqueous powder processing should be employed and the latter is in most cases a costly process.

On the other hand, in the hydrologist, assistance with solidification forming blocks, process, aluminum nitrate is a set engagement where the hydrolysis is exploited in the solidification of Equus ceramic suspension in impermeable mode.
As I already mentioned, it can be also used for formation of nanostructured alumina coatings.
For these two processes, elevated hydrolysis temperature are required.
For the aluminum nitrate powder hydrolyzed room temperature, Boeing with his coworkers proposed the following reaction scheme where aluminum nitride first reacts with water forming.
Amorphous aluminum hydroxide, so called soda boehmite, which later dissolves and recrystallized us by right.

This is so called the solution recrystallization process and overall reaction kinetics were described by unreacted core model where the chemical reaction at unreacted core product layer interface was proposed to be the rate controlling step.

On the other hand, for the aluminum nitrate hydrolysis at elevated temperature there there are only few reports in the literature and there is a lack of agreement on the solid hydrolysis reaction product.
So our aim of the work was to study the influence of temperature and some time on the aluminum nitrate powder hydrolysis.
In product.
In the experimental experimental work, aluminum nitrate powder with medium particle size of 1.2 microns.
Surface area of 6 square meters.
Program an oxygen content of 2.5 weight percents with then dies water were used.
For the hydrolysis test, 3 weight percent of luminated powder water suspension were prepared.
The hydrolysis temperature variety from room temperature up to the 90 degree C, whereas time of hydrolysis variety from 15 minutes to 24 hours.
The crystalline phase is found after hydrolyzing the aluminum nitrate powder.
Were characterized using XRD, SMTM and AFM analysis.
The results of the exordium analysis together with the incubation time.
Of the illuminated powder hydrolyze at various temperature and times are summarized in the table.
The first crystalline reaction product found after hydrolyzing aluminum nitrate powder at room temperature was by right, which is in line with the results of Bowen.
At higher temperatures, like 40 and 5 degrees C, The BI Rite was detected sooner, accompanied with bear might.
At even higher temperatures, 67th, 1890 degrees C. The first crystalline product was a boehmite.
With by right crystallising subsequently with time.
Some authors stated that above about 80 degrees C, The conversion from Boehmite to buy right is not likely to occur.
However, according to the results in the table, after 8 hours of aging, we did detect some by right using XRD analysis.
Let's look at the morphologies to begin with.
This is apparent aluminum nitrate powder as a micrograph.
This is a sea micrograph of aluminum nitrate powder, hydrolized room temperature for 24 hours.
In comparison to.
To the park, to the parent illuminated powder.
The mythology here is changed, even though the extra day analysis revealed that the most the most of lunatic power was still unreacted.
At this stage, large by right summer toys were observed, and there was also some discrete areas, consisting of nanostructured agglomerates resembling that theater.
Boehmite was detected by SCM, though.
Undetectable with the XRD.

The sea micrograph of the Lumina nitrile powder hard lights at 50 degrees C at 15 minutes, revealed that the surface of the aluminum nitrate particles was hydrolized, and in addition we did the TM analysis and TM analysis showed that this surface layer consists of.
Still, the Boehmite nano crystallites.
Now, this is the morphology of the powder hydrolized at 90 degrees C for 15 minutes.
Agglomerates of boehmite are nicely visible.
And finally, this is the sea micro graph of the Lumina natural powder paralyzed at 90 degrees C for 24 hours and large Poly crystalline by right.
So matroids were form form surrounded by bear might agglomerates.
The XRD diffraction pattern in this image is a proof of that and Moreover with even longer aging time times the peak intensity of by right face increased.
So according to the results, an extension of bonus model for elevated temperatures for the aluminum nitrate powder hydrolysis was proposed.
One syllable might this form part of it will be transformed to crystalline by right, while the other part will further react to form.
Boehmite and our hypothesis was that this dissolution recrystallization process can be used in the formation of nanostructured alumina coatings on a substrate.
And we managed to synthesize a nano leaves like boehmite coating on the Ciconia ceramics.
In this after thermal treatment, this boehmite coating at 1200 degrees C transforms 2A alumina.
Or to Delta alumina at 900 degrees C with.
No substantial change in morphology.
We also measure the thickness of the alumina coating after the thermal treatment using atomic force microscope and get the.
And here is the result.
The coating is 249 millimeters thick.
In addition, here is a sea micrograph of the of the profile of the coating.
This is the coating and this is the cercone, a Polish Laconia.
Now let me show one of the possible applications of this coating.
Nowadays partially stabilized.
Yttria tetragonal ciconia is widely used in dentistry.
In dental restorations due to its good mechanical properties and its natural appearance appearance.
Compared to metal dental restorations?
And we did.
We measure adhesive bond strength of the dental segment, uncoated and coated ciconia surface.
So applying the alumina coating to the polished center or abraded ciconia surface resulted in remarkable improvement of the adhesion of the dental salmon.

So to conclude, for the reaction of aluminum nitrate with water at room temperature, the bones model was confirmed based on the results and extension of bones model for elevated temperature is proposed.
The results of this study were used in the synthesis of the nanostructured alumina coatings and the adhesion of the dental segment on the partially stabilized heater attachment.
Ciconia surface was improved.
Thank you for your attention.
